title: Hi, I’m Caleb.
text: I’m an analytics-driven problem solver building a second career after a 10-year tenure as a manufacturing process engineer. I am passionate about building consensus with data, inside and outside of the workplace.

title: Personal
text: One of my best friends - my big mutt, Eddie. Can you guess his breed mix? Check out Eddie’s Embark DNA test.

title: BI Portfolio
text:
Disclaimer



By nature, it is challenging to build a business intelligence portfolio since most BI work is generated for internal company use. Examples on this page are a small subset of my work that is publicly available. I hope to add more to this portfolio in the near future.

title: BI Portfolio
section: Utah Transit Authority - Free Fare February Report
text:
Utah Transit Authority - Free Fare February Report



UTA declared “Free Fare February” (FFF) in 2022, granting free access to all public transit modes (bus, light rail, commuter rail, and more). A large increase in ridership (>20%) was observed as a result, leading to nationwide interest in a post-mortem report.Using Power BI, I generated all the data visualizations for the FFF report. I also read and manually categorized about 2,000 customer comments for sentiment analysis.

title: BI Portfolio
section: Personal Power BI Project - Utah Air Quality
text:
Personal Power BI Project - Utah Air Quality






Warning



This project is a work in progress and should not be used for official planning or reporting purposes.










Utah intermittently has some of the worst air quality in the United States due to the bowl-shaped topography of the mountains which surround the Wasatch Front, wildfires, and inversion effects.In April 2022, I began working on a Power BI report to analyze recent and historical air quality trends in Utah. Using Microsoft Azure cloud services, I set up a pipeline to scrape data from EPA and AirNow.gov APIs. The report automatically refreshes with new data each morning.
